questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
Which of the following is the correct structure for an HTML document?
Which HTML element is used to define the title of a document?
What is the purpose of the <body> tag in HTML?
options: It defines the document's head section.
It contains all the content such as text, images, and links.
It is used to define the main content of an HTML document.
It specifies the body of the email content in HTML.
questions.answer: It contains all the content such as text, images, and links.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which tag is used to display images in HTML?
What attribute is used to provide the path of an image in the tag?
Which HTML tag is used to create an unordered list?

What does the
tag do?
options: It breaks the text into two sections.
It adds a new row in a table.

questions.question: In HTML, what does the `fieldset` tag do?
options: It is used to group related data in a form.
It sets the field to a fixed size.
It automatically validates the fields within a form.
It hides the fields in a form.
questions.answer: It is used to group related data in a form.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
Which HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
How do you insert a comment in a CSS file?
Which property is used to change the background color of an element?

How do you apply a style to all

elements?
Which property is used to change the font of an element?
How do you make each word in a text start with a capital letter?
How do you select an element with the class name 'header'?
What is the default value of the 'position' property?
What is the purpose of the z-index property in CSS?
options: To count the number of elements
To set the magnification level of an element
To specify the stack order of an element
questions.answer: To specify the stack order of an element

questions.question: Which syntax is correct to output 'Hello World' in an alert box?
How do you call a function named 'myFunction'?
How to write an IF statement in JavaScript?
How to write an IF statement for executing some code if 'i' is NOT equal to 5?
How does a FOR loop start?
How can you add a comment in a JavaScript?
What is the correct way to write a JavaScript array?
How do you find the number with the highest value of x and y?
Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?
What is the correct way to write a JavaScript object?
What does 'WCAG' stand for?
Which element is used to provide alternative text for images for screen reader users?
What does ARIA stand for in web development?
Which of the following is not a principle of the WCAG?
Which of these color contrast ratios defines the minimum WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirement for normal text?
Which of the following elements is inherently focusable, meaning it can receive focus without a 'tabindex' attribute?
What is the purpose of the 'lang' attribute in an HTML page?
options: To indicate the language of the page content
questions.answer: To indicate the language of the page content

questions.question: Which guideline ensures that content is accessible by keyboard as well as by mouse?
What is the role of 'skip navigation' links in web accessibility?
options: To skip over primary navigation to the main content
To provide shortcuts to different sections of the website
To help users skip unwanted sections like advertisements
To bypass broken links in the navigation
questions.answer: To skip over primary navigation to the main content

questions.question: Which of these tools can help in checking the accessibility of a website?
What is ReactJS?
options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A CSS framework for styling web applications
questions.answer: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

questions.question: Which command is used to create a new React app?
What is JSX?
What is the virtual DOM?
options: A virtual machine for running JavaScript code
A representation of the actual DOM tree in memory
A DOM tree created by React components
A tool for debugging React applications
questions.answer: A representation of the actual DOM tree in memory

questions.question: What is the purpose of PropTypes in React?
options: To define the types of props passed to a component
To manage state in functional components
questions.answer: To define the types of props passed to a component

questions.question: What lifecycle method is called before a component is removed from the DOM?
What does state represent in React?
What is the purpose of the key attribute in React lists?
options: To specify the order of list items
To provide a unique identifier to each list item
questions.answer: To provide a unique identifier to each list item

questions.question: What is the recommended way to update state that depends on the previous state value?
options: Using setState() without a callback function
Using setState() with an arrow function
Directly modifying state outside of setState()
questions.answer: Using setState() with an arrow function

questions.question: Which hook is used to perform side effects in functional components?
What is Redux?
options: A state management library for JavaScript applications
questions.answer: A state management library for JavaScript applications

questions.question: What is an action in Redux?
options: A function that returns a new state
A plain JavaScript object describing a change
A component in the Redux architecture
A middleware for handling side effects
questions.answer: A plain JavaScript object describing a change

questions.question: What is a reducer in Redux?
options: A function that returns a new state
A component responsible for rendering UI
A built-in method for updating state
A middleware for handling asynchronous actions
questions.answer: A function that returns a new state

questions.question: What is the purpose of the combineReducers function in Redux?
options: To combine multiple reducers into a single reducer function
To create a store instance in Redux
To apply middleware to the Redux store
questions.answer: To combine multiple reducers into a single reducer function

questions.question: What is the Redux store?
options: An object that holds the application state
A server for handling HTTP requests
A function for updating React components
A middleware for handling side effects
questions.answer: An object that holds the application state

questions.question: What is the purpose of the connect function in React-Redux?
options: To connect React components to the Redux store
To create action creators in Redux
To handle asynchronous actions in Redux
To apply middleware to the Redux store
questions.answer: To connect React components to the Redux store

questions.question: What is middleware in Redux?
options: Functions that intercept actions before they reach the reducer
A component responsible for rendering UI
A method for updating state in reducers
A built-in method for handling side effects
questions.answer: Functions that intercept actions before they reach the reducer

questions.question: What is the Redux DevTools extension used for?
options: To inspect and debug Redux applications
To handle asynchronous actions in Redux
questions.answer: To inspect and debug Redux applications

questions.question: What is an action creator in Redux?
options: A function that creates an action object
A component responsible for rendering UI
A middleware for handling side effects
A function that returns a new state
questions.answer: A function that creates an action object

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Redux Thunk middleware?
options: To handle asynchronous actions in Redux
To create action creators in Redux
To apply middleware to the Redux store
questions.answer: To handle asynchronous actions in Redux

questions.question: What is Java?
Which keyword is used to define a class in Java?
What is the default value of the primitive type 'int' in Java?
Which data structure is used to implement the 'last in, first out' (LIFO) behavior in Java?
Which keyword is used to declare a method that does not return any value in Java?
What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in Java?
options: To create an instance of a class
To specify that a method belongs to the class, not the instance
To prevent a class from being subclassed
questions.answer: To specify that a method belongs to the class, not the instance

questions.question: Which collection class is synchronized in Java?
What is the superclass of all classes in Java?
Which loop in Java does not have a condition to terminate?
What is the output of 'System.out.println(5 / 2)' in Java?
